Package projectiles

Class ProjectileManager

java.lang.Object
projectiles.ProjectileManager
public class ProjectileManager extends Object
This class will be a manager/factory for the Playing GameState. This allows all of the moving/collision logic to be stored outside of the zPlaying state
Author:
Sean-Paul Brown

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(int[][] levelData)
      This method updates each Projectile and checks their end-case (when they should de-spawn)
      Parameters:
      levelData - - the current Level represented as a 2D int array

    • collisionCheck

      private boolean collisionCheck(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox, int[][] levelData, float xSpeed, float ySpeed)
      Checks to see if the Projectile placed into the equation collides with the level or exceeds the bounds
      Parameters:
      p - - the Projectile to check collision with
      levelData - - the current Level represented as a 2D int array
      Returns:
      true if the arrow collides with anything, false if not.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g, int xLevelOffset)
      This method will draw every projectile on screen.
      Parameters:
      g - - the Graphics of where to draw the arrows
      xLevelOffset - - the offset from the screenscrolling horizontally

    • checkEnemyHit

      public boolean checkEnemyHit(Enemy e)
      Check if a certain Enemy (doesn't matter the type) collides with any projectile in the ProjectileMnager.
      Parameters:
      e - - the specific Enemy to check.
      Returns:
      ture if the enemy was hit by an arrow, false if the enemy wasn't.

    • newArrow

      public void newArrow(float x, float y, float slope, boolean left)
      This will create a new arrow in the arrowList here, so it can the arrow can be managed
      Parameters:
      x - - the x coordinate of the new Arrow, will be left-bounds of hitbox
      y - - the y coordinate of the new Arrow, will be top-bounds of hitbox
      slope - - the slope/path that the arrow will take
      left - - a boolean determining if the Arrow is moving left (true if left, false if right)

    • reset

      public void reset()
      This method deletes all Projectiles stored in the manager. Should be used when starting/restarting a level.
